alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 22 at 3:48AM HST until January 24 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .A large west-northwest (280-310 degrees) will slowly ease today, then trend back up tonight through Tuesday as a similar west- northwest swell arrives. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 12 to 16 feet along north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, and Oahu. Surf of 10 to 15 feet along north facing shores of Molokai and Maui. Surf of 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Molokai and 7 to 10 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, north facing shores of Maui, and west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Surf will slowly ease today, then trend back up tonight through Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
